Add timepoint to data

Source: R/add.R
add_timepoint.Rd

Calculated sequential timepoint for participants along the 'age' column.

add_timepoint(data, name = timepoint)

Arguments

data

data extracted from the NOAS
name

unquoted name to give the new column

Value

data frame with extra column with timepoint

Examples

# attach built-in noas example data to test
dt <- noas_example

add_timepoint(dt)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 9
#> # Groups:   subject_id [2]
#>    subject_id project_id wave_code site_name folder    visit_age   cog sex   
#>    <chr>      <chr>          <dbl> <chr>     <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> <chr> 
#>  1 1000000    MemP               1 ousAvanto 1000000_1         8    16 female
#>  2 1000000    MemP               2 ousAvanto 1000000_2        10    14 female
#>  3 1000000    MemP               3 ousAvanto 1000000_3        14    16 female
#>  4 1000000    MemP               3 ousSkyra  1000000_4        14    NA female
#>  5 1000000    MemP               4 ousSkyra  1000000_5        17    15 female
#>  6 1000000    MemP               5 ousSkyra  1000000_6        20    15 female
#>  7 1000010    MemC               1 ousSkyra  1000010_1        22    14 male  
#>  8 1000010    MemC               2 ousSkyra  1000010_2        28    13 male  
#>  9 1000010    MemC               3 ousSkyra  1000010_3        33    NA male  
#> 10 1000010    MemC               4 ousSkyra  1000010_4        40    10 male  
#> # … with 1 more variable: timepoint <dbl>

library(dplyr)
dt %>%
 add_timepoint()

#> # A tibble: 10 x 9
#> # Groups:   subject_id [2]
#>    subject_id project_id wave_code site_name folder    visit_age   cog sex   
#>    <chr>      <chr>          <dbl> <chr>     <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> <chr> 
#>  1 1000000    MemP               1 ousAvanto 1000000_1         8    16 female
#>  2 1000000    MemP               2 ousAvanto 1000000_2        10    14 female
#>  3 1000000    MemP               3 ousAvanto 1000000_3        14    16 female
#>  4 1000000    MemP               3 ousSkyra  1000000_4        14    NA female
#>  5 1000000    MemP               4 ousSkyra  1000000_5        17    15 female
#>  6 1000000    MemP               5 ousSkyra  1000000_6        20    15 female
#>  7 1000010    MemC               1 ousSkyra  1000010_1        22    14 male  
#>  8 1000010    MemC               2 ousSkyra  1000010_2        28    13 male  
#>  9 1000010    MemC               3 ousSkyra  1000010_3        33    NA male  
#> 10 1000010    MemC               4 ousSkyra  1000010_4        40    10 male  
#> # … with 1 more variable: timepoint <dbl>

# Change the name of the variable
dt %>%
 add_timepoint(name = tp)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 9
#> # Groups:   subject_id [2]
#>    subject_id project_id wave_code site_name folder  visit_age   cog sex      tp
#>    <chr>      <chr>          <dbl> <chr>     <chr>       <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <dbl>
#>  1 1000000    MemP               1 ousAvanto 100000…         8    16 fema…     1
#>  2 1000000    MemP               2 ousAvanto 100000…        10    14 fema…     2
#>  3 1000000    MemP               3 ousAvanto 100000…        14    16 fema…     3
#>  4 1000000    MemP               3 ousSkyra  100000…        14    NA fema…     3
#>  5 1000000    MemP               4 ousSkyra  100000…        17    15 fema…     4
#>  6 1000000    MemP               5 ousSkyra  100000…        20    15 fema…     5
#>  7 1000010    MemC               1 ousSkyra  100001…        22    14 male      1
#>  8 1000010    MemC               2 ousSkyra  100001…        28    13 male      2
#>  9 1000010    MemC               3 ousSkyra  100001…        33    NA male      3
#> 10 1000010    MemC               4 ousSkyra  100001…        40    10 male      4
